title: Understanding 'Macro'
text: In Excel, a 'macro' is a set of actions that you can run to automate tasks in spreadsheets. It saves time by executing repetitive processes through a single command or button.

title: Meta Information of 'Programming Language'
text: Programming Language' refers to a syntax and set of instructions used to write computer programs. It's the medium you use to interact with computers to carry out tasks and solve problems.

title: Finding Out Which Programming Language
text: If you are editing and cleaning macros in Excel, the programming language most directly associated with these tasks is a variant of BASIC used within the Microsoft Office suite.

title: Explanation of 'Visual Basic for Applications' (VBA)
text: VBA' stands for Visual Basic for Applications. It is a programming language created by Microsoft and is used within Microsoft Office applications to enhance their capabilities through automation.
